result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip Alan Hofer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-In Public, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is allowed work release privileges.
Defendant shall have no contact with C.U.H. except as allowed by his probation agent.
Defendant shall participate in counseling as deemed appropriate by his probation agent.
Costs have been paid in full from cash bond that was posted.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant shall serve 60 days in the Lafayette County Jail commencing 05/19/17 at or before 7:00 p.m.
Sentence may be served in Dane County if arrangements can be made.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Count 2

copy of refund check to Mary Sigafus

Defendant Phillip Alan Hofer in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel.   D.A. Craig Nolen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Amended Information is filed by D.A. Nolen.
Atty Angel acknowledges receipt of the same.
Court reads charging portion of Amended Information into the record.
Defendant enters "No Contest" plea to Counts 1 and 2 of the Amended Information.
D.A. Nolen informs Court that victim notification was made.
Court questions Def. re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds pleas are made freely, knowingly and voluntarily; that there is factual basis.
Court accpets pleas, finds Def. guilty of Counts 1 and 2 of the Amended Information.
State requests 24 month withheld sentence/probation with conditions:
- 60 days jail on each count, concurrent, commencing 5/19/17
- no contact with C.U.H. unless allowed by probation agent
- counseling as deemed appropriate by probation agent
Atty Angel concurs and gives further comments.  Informs Court that Def. is employed in Dane County and requests he be allowed to serve jail time in Dane County.
Court orders: sentence withheld, 24 months probation, with conditions as follows:
- 60 days jail on each count, concurrent, with work release, commencing 5/19/17 at 7:00 p.m., 5 days sentence credit (may be served in Dane County if arrangements can be made)
- no contact with C.U.H. except as allowed by probation agent
- counseling as deemed appropriate
- follow all other rules of supervision
- costs
Court orders any bond posted to be applied to costs.
Court informs Def. of appeal rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2017 at 08:59 am.
